derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Latin procreat- 'generated, brought forth', from the verb procreare, from pro- 'forth' + creare 'create'

entry.def: When animals or people procreate, they produce young or babies.

example.ex: Most young women  feel a biological need to procreate.
example.tran: 大多数的年轻妇女都有生儿育女的生理需要。

sentences.sentence: "The deer in our neighborhood reproduce madly"
"The Catholic Church tells people to procreate, no matter what their economic situation may be"

stems_affixes.word_buile: create[v.创造,创作;引起,造成,建立]+ive……的→adj.有创造力的,创造性的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 生产的, 有生殖力的
stems_affixes.word_buile: procreate[v.生育,繁殖]+ive……的→adj.生产的, 有生殖力的
create[v.创造,创作;引起,造成,建立]+ure表名词→创造物→生物
re重新+crea生长+tion表名词→恢复精力→娱乐,消遣
pro向前+create创造→不断创造,创造很多→生儿育女
re再+create[v.创造,创作;引起,造成,建立]→v.重获创造,再创造

stems_affixes.type_exp: 1. 表示"赞同,亲…"; 2. 也有"代替"之意; 3. 表示"向前,在前;预先"; 4. 表示"很多…"
